title: Can we give Kha's Q an actual mana cost?
body:
It's 20 at all ranks.
Literally nothing; this is why Kha is broken at the moment, there is no penalty or cost to using Q (which does 400-500 damage already).
even 20/25/30/35/40 would be better...

replies.body: I liked it better when his Q did nearly no damage when someone wasn't isolated but when they were alone he fukt them up like a real assassin would. Now it doesn't matter if you're isolated or not he's still going to nuke you

I'm sure his Q dmg is no where near any of it's past iterations, if anything the dps has increased when isolated compared to past iterations when evolved and isolated. 

If we're looking specifically for non isolated targets, then current one is not the worse, and probably is actually around the same damage for every iteration, but I know for sure, the worse was when riot for some reason buffed his Q evolve so that whether the target was isolated or not dealt the bonus %missing hp dmg. So that is the worse to deal with as a non isolated target

you think you would even blink if the old kha'zix used the non nerfed current masteries? lol i'd oneshot you midair without even landing to autoattack like i have to do now. We would be able to doublejumpfrom full hp targets not half hp targets in montages.

It really isn't. If you want to give him a significant nerf, nerf his unisolated damage. That shit does not even matter anymore. Even as a Kha'Zix main I can forget I can kind of just easily fight people without that mechanic anymore.

Or you can nerf his passive damage which now scales with AD and contributes to a huge amount of his damage now. Especially when 1 AA + Q counts for a Thunderlords proc.

Why would you want to nerf his UNisolated damage? His isolation is SO cancerous since you have to be piggybacking on someone else the entire game or he can just rape you for 1000 damage in less than a second.

Grouping is an assassin's weakness. The people who play smart like that already invalidate his influence quite a bit, but he's always been specifically a strong solo queue pick because people ALWAYS try to be the hero and splitpush by themselves with no vision of the enemy. Kha'Zix is always as common as how many times people overextend in ranked lol.

Because it was his identity as a champion to kill any isolated champs. He was THE champ known for that. Sure the isolated damage was and to an extent still is cancerous. His clear counterplay was grouping and it hit him the hardest of all assassins before his ratios were changed to benefit fighting unisolated champs a little more. And besides, if an assassin is roaming the map and you're a squishy sitting in lane solo you 100% deserved to die. He's not really any different from other assassins in that regard, but we're only really complaining about him while he's meta.

I love how literally now means figuratively.  When a word means its antonym, there has to be an issue xD

I really wish Riot would make up their mind about mana. All the old champions have real (high) mana costs, and virtually all of the newer ones have costs so low that they barely matter at all. Riot kind of decided they didn't like having champs run out of mana, but never rebalanced the old champions around that idea.

Kha'Zix's early sustain without blue is pretty garbage. It used to have a higher mana cost but it was toned down due to Kha'Zix struggling to clear the jungle. He also had the W healing issue where the jungle would just smash him.

Junglers that are potent right now can consistently fight the jungle, and anything not made for that will be overall slower/less effective. I'd rather they not nerf champions to force them to buy {{item:2032}} , because that's essentially what the mana cost nerf would be doing. I'm not saying Kha is balanced 100% right now but most of his success comes from his natural predators not being as strong as him in the meta, i.e. Sejuani, Zac, and especially things like Nunu. If they were popular then you'd be seeing possible Kha buffs because they lower his impact exponentially.

>this is why Kha is broken at the moment

He's not broken at the moment, though.
Also if he were, that wouldn't be why. Increasing his Q mana cost would be a nerf for the sake of nerfing something, and not actually addressing anything that's problematic in his kit.
